message.content:
Layoff refers to cutting or suspending employees from their jobs temporarily, often used by companies facing financial difficulties. It could be a cost-saving measure to help the company survive or facilitate restructuring without permanently firing employees.

Redundancy is when an employee's job role is no longer required due to changes in business requirements, operations or staffing needs. This leads to the permanent termination of employment as the position no longer exists within the organization. Redundancies usually occur during reorganizations, mergers and acquisitions, downsizing, or economic downturns.

In both cases, employers attempt to reduce workforce costs but redundancies typically result in terminating employment altogether whereas layoffs may be temporary with employees returning back once conditions improve.
